intro: Cyrtandra neohebridensis, commonly known as the New Hebrides cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
